title: Looking Beyond GDP - A Deeper Dive into India's Economic Reality
selftext:
Hey I have recently written this article. Can you please get some feedback if possible. Thanks.  
[Looking Beyond GDP - A Deeper Dive into India's Economic Reality](https://sanskarb.blogspot.com/2023/08/looking-beyond-gdp-deeper-dive-into.html)
comments:
It's good that you have used PPP GDP figures for comparison since exchange rates can skew comparisons.

However, I am not sure if it is the best idea to compare a developing country like India with developed countries like Germany or the UK. A better idea would be to compare India with its peers - Indonesia, Brazil, Mexico etc.

Also, one important indicator of a country's potential is the Economic Complexity Indicator (ECI) rankings. Surprisingly, India fares well on many indicators. It isn't an outlier like China but does better than many other countries. The relatively high ECI ranking denotes higher economic reslisience and shows that India has better growth prospects than Bangladesh, despite having similar PPP GDP per capita.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economic_Complexity_Index#:~:text=The%20Economic%20Complexity%20Index%20(ECI,cities%2C%20regions%2C%20or%20countries.

Another indicator that I would consider is the HDI rankings. India doesn't do as badly as it is assumed but can surely move up the rankings.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Development_Index

The PPP GDP along with the ECI and HDI rankings are a good indicator of a country's present position and growth potential.
